document_data.mainbody: '''Emirikol the Chaotic''' was an infamous [[human]] [[sorcerer]] and [[wizard]] that had traveled across many worlds in the [[multiverse]].
document_data.Description: Emirikol dressed in simple, yet elegant clothes and sported a dark, well-trimmed beard.
document_data.Personality: Emirikol was an incredibly passionate individual who was prone to rapid shifts in his mood. He had a heroic core, a desire to do good, but he often he wrestled between this and his desire to gain magical power.
document_data.Abilities:
Emirikol was a powerful wielder of [[arcane magic]], He was also said to have perfected the use of ''[[disintegrate]]'', having used it to destroy countless foes and underlings that had displeased him,<ref> and had a ''[[contingency]]'' on him to cast ''disintegrate'' if he was attacked physically. He could also cast ''[[power word, kill]]''.

According to some accounts, later in his life Emirikol became permanently under the effect of a ''[[potion of flying]]'' after having experimented with a number of [[potion]] combinations.
document_data.Possessions:
Emirikol possessed an ''[[amulet of the planes]]'', an ''[[earring of protection]] +5'', a ''[[ring of joining]]'', a ''[[ring of wizardry]]'', a ''[[rod of beguiling]]'', a ''[[wand of wonder]]'',

Emirikol also owned a [[wand]] that could cast ''[[prismatic sphere]]'', ''[[prismatic spray]]'', and ''[[prismatic wall]]''. And a robe that acted as both a ''[[robe of the archmagi]]'' and a ''[[robe of scintillating colors]]'', but whose effects were only accessible by wild mages.
document_data.Activities: Emirikol spent most of his time dealing with matters pertaining to other worlds and [[plane]]s across the multiverse.

History.A Paladin In Hell: In the late-15{{th}} century [[DR]], Klysandral passed away. Some sources claimed this occurred on the world of [[Toril]],{{Cite adventurers league/Hellfire Requiem|3}} while others said it was on Oerth.''[[Hellfire Requiem]]'' is sort of a remake of the older adventure module, ''A Paladin in Hell''. For the sake of completeness and because ''Hellfire Requiem'' itself states that the history of Emirikol's life is hard to pin down, we have opted to present both versions of events.

document_data.Rumors & Legends: Throughout various points of his life rumors circulated that Emirikol had in his possession one of the [[orb of dragonkind|''orbs of dragonkind]], the ''[[Codex of the Infinite Planes]]'', and the ''[[Machine of Lum the Mad]]''. By the late-15{{th}} century DR, Emirikol was rumored to possess the ''[[eye of Vecna]]'' and an ''orb of dragonkind''.
